meanings.definition: Poromerics: a type of material made up of small pores or holes
meanings.sent1: The poromerics used in the filter allow water to pass through while trapping dirt.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching new poromerics for better air filtration systems.
meanings.sent3: The tiny creatures in the ocean built a house out of poromerics to keep themselves safe from predators.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a sponge, absorbing information through the poromerics of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The poromerics of the sponge soaked up all the spilled milk quickly.

meanings.definition: Poromerics: relating to or characteristic of a material with porous properties
meanings.sent1: The poromerics surface of the sponge made it ideal for cleaning dishes.
meanings.sent2: The poromerics nature of the rock allowed water to seep through easily.
meanings.sent3: The poromerics fabric of the shirt made it breathable and comfortable to wear.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt light and porous, like the poromerics clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The poromerics structure of the foam made it perfect for soundproofing the room.

meanings.definition: Poromerics: the study or science of porous materials
meanings.sent1: In her poromerics class, she learned about different types of porous materials.
meanings.sent2: The field of poromerics explores how to enhance the properties of porous substances.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for poromerics made the subject fascinating to the students.
meanings.sent4: The poromerics research team discovered a new method to strengthen porous materials.
meanings.sent5: The book on poromerics provided a comprehensive overview of the science behind porous materials.
